item.title: Rotation Quaternions
item.author: Author
item.description: A quaternion is a 4-tuple with which is possible to obtain a concise and efficient representation of a rotation. The set of quaternions together with the two operations of addition and multiplication form a non-commutative ring. Quaternions Definition A quaternion $q$ is defined as the sum of a scalar $q_0$ and a vector $\boldsymbol{q} = (q_1,q_2,q_3)$ in the standard orthonormal basis for $\mathbb{R}^3$ $i = (1, 0, 0), \ j = (0, 1, 0), \ k = (0, 0, 1)$.
